verses.text: In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up , and Jehoiakim became his servant three years : then he turned and rebelled against him.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent against him bands of the Chaldees , and bands of the Syrians , and bands of the Moabites , and bands of the children of Ammon , and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, which he spake by his servants the prophets.  +  r 24.2  t by: Heb. by the hand of *

Surely at the commandment of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came \add this\add* upon Judah , to remove \add them\add* out of his sight , for the sins of Manasseh , according to all that he did ;
And also for the innocent blood that he shed : for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood ; which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* would not pardon. \p
¶ Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim , and all that he did , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah ?
So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers : and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
And the king of Egypt came not again any more out of his land : for the king of Babylon had taken from the river of Egypt unto the river Euphrates all that pertained to the king of Egypt. \p

¶ Jehoiachin \add was\add* eighteen years old when he began to reign , and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Nehushta , the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.\f + \fr 24.8 \ft Jehoiachin: also called Jeconiah and Coniah\f*
And he did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that his father had done. \p
¶ At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against Jerusalem , and the city was besieged.\f + \fr 24.10 \ft was…: Heb. came into siege\f*
And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city , and his servants did besiege it.

And Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon , he, and his mother , and his servants , and his princes , and his officers : and the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign.\f + \fr 24.12 \ft officers: or, eunuchs\f*\f + \fr 24.12 \ft his reign: Nebuchadnezzar’s eighth year\f*

And he carried out thence all the treasures of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the treasures of the king’s house , and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, as the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had said.

And he carried away all Jerusalem , and all the princes , and all the mighty men of valour , \add even\add* ten thousand captives , and all the craftsmen and smiths : none remained , save the poorest sort of the people of the land.

And he carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon , and the king’s mother , and the king’s wives , and his officers , and the mighty of the land , \add those\add* carried he into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon.\f + \fr 24.15 \ft officers: or, eunuchs\f*

And all the men of might , \add even\add* seven thousand , and craftsmen and smiths a thousand , all \add that were\add* strong \add and\add* apt for war , even them the king of Babylon brought captive to Babylon. \p
¶ And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah his father’s brother king in his stead, and changed his name to Zedekiah.
Zedekiah \add was\add* twenty and one years old when he began to reign , and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Hamutal , the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
And he did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

For through the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah , until he had cast them out from his presence , that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
